measure.name: Exterior Wall Insulation and Finish System
measure.description: Add an exterior insulation and finish system, with 4" EPS board, R-16, and reduce infiltration by 30%. This can greater lower heat transfer through walls in older buildings with brick or stone exteriors that do not have wall insulation.
measure.modeler_description:
Add a 4" EPS insulation layer to the building exterior wall construction:
Material, EPS insulation, !- Name Rough, !- Roughness 0.1016, !- Thickness {m} 0.0360563953045152, !- Conductivity {W/m-K} 25.6295413983362, !- Density {kg/m3} 1465.38, !- Specific Heat {J/kg-K} 0.9, !- Thermal Absorptance 0.7, !- Solar Absorptance 0.7; !- Visible Absorptance
Reduce ZoneInfiltration:DesignFlowRate Flow per Exterior Surface Area {m3/s-m2} by 30%[1] [1]Public Works & Government Services Canada. (1993). Air Leakage Control: Retrofit Measures for High-Rise Office Buildings. Note that this is an older study targeting high-rise buildings, which are not typical for office buildings. This particular measures was used to model wall insulation savings from a leakier, older building, where a 30% reduction in infiltration would be reasonable.
